intro: Psoralea cephalotes, commonly known as the helmeted psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, helmet-shaped flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually small and pinnate, while its flowers range in color from yellow to orange. Psoralea cephalotes is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
